name: Pepper Tree
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
Stitched with Sulky Blendables Thread in Red Brick on Weeks Dye Works 30 count Baby's Breath linen.

Stitch count is 91 x 91.

name: Turtles All the Way Down
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
An infinitely tall stack of turtles for your stitching pleasure. Fortunately, they get smaller towards the bottom.

What does it all mean? Besides being a great design perfect for anyone who likes turtles, the design represents an ancient creative cosmological theory. Without an understanding of planetary gravity, some philosophers theorized that the earth was held up atop the back of a large turtle. When asked what was holding up that turtle, they responded that it was another turtle. And beneath that; another turtle. In fact, it was "turtles all the way down." 

The turtles are stitched with different shades of DMC, but just as the height of your stack can be easily adjusted, the colors can easily be changed to suit whatever turtly needs you have and whatever specialty fibers might be calling to you. The stitching band and bell pull hardware can be ordered through Wichelt.

name: Irish Springs
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
This one is based on a Celtic pen and ink drawing I did a few years ago, which in turn reflects a style of Tree of Life found in centuries old Celtic illuminated manuscripts. Stitch this design using Sullivans threads, as I did, or their DMC counterparts. The gentle palette and swirling branches make this bell pull a beautiful and easy-to-finish piece.  The stitching band and bell pull hardware can be ordered through Wichelt.

name: Damask Square
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
Lacy and delicate, this is a good mid-sized monochromatic project coming in at 107 stitches square. It's shown in DMC Variations thread on Weeks Dye Works 30 count Putty linen, but it would be lovely in a multitude of different floss and fabric combinations.

name: Square Dance
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
Two full charts in one pack.
This should keep those of us who love little square motifs in spades for quite some time.

The Gameboard design is 225 x 225, stiched with Valdani Threads on Picture This Plus 32 count Doubloon linen.

The monochromatic side of Square Dance is 203 x 203 stitches and was stitched with Gloriana Rosewood Silk on 40 count Shale linen by Picture This Plus.

name: Friendly Flower Bot
description:
Cross Stitch Chart
This friendly robot is programmed to bring a smile to your face when he presents you with this freshly cut bouquet. He grew these flowers himself. He is stitched up with Weeks Dye Works cotton floss on Weeks' Charlotte's Pink 30 count linen.

name: Phlox Box
description:
This one actually came out in the May 2012 Cross Stitch & Needlework Magazine, so don't buy it again if you've got your copy. But if you are one of those looking for a sold-out back issue or can't get the magazine where you live, the chart is now available separately.

Cross stitch chart only. Stitch count is 111 square. The model is shown stitched in Evergreen Belle Soie Silk by Crescent Colours on Confetti 32ct Belfast linen by Picture This Plus. There are 5372 stitches, which took 10 yards of 12-ply silk.  It will clearly lend itself to any color scheme you can dream up.

name: Wild Side
description:
Let your color choices determine the mood for this piece: from mild to wild, or anything in between. You're likely to have your next color combination picked out before you finish stitching it once.  The design is 61 stitches square. Shown in a variety of Dinky-Dyes silks on linen. 

Chart only.

name: The Birds and the Bees
description:
A new Celtic monochromatic. Interwoven borders surround a collection of unusual flowers and fanciful fowl. In the center a busy buzzy hive lends to the second half of the name.

Cross Stitch Chart. Size is 137w x 179h. Stitched with Gloriana's Havana Brown Silk on Ancient 40 count linen by Picture This Plus. For those calculating silk needed, there were 10,647 stitches.

name: Water Hazard
description:
This small vignette is the third release a series of designs from Ink Circles called the Bad Neighborhoods. Each shows us what appears at first glance to be a nice place to take up residence. Upon closer inspection, we find that there is something amiss. Something that would make this a very bad neighborhood to live in after all.

Who wouldn't love to visit this charming lakeside cottage? Wildflowers blooming everywhere, trees blowing in a gentle wind, the little pathway that winds toward the door. And the wildlife, did we mention the spectacular wildlife? Just keep the poodle inside! 

There are 6 designs in this series. They will use a common color palette and will all be the same size, making it easy to combine them into a  larger design.

Cross stitch chart.  Each in the series are 71w x 81h. Stitched on Weeks Dye Works 30 count Baby's Breath linen using Gentle Arts Sampler and Shaker Threads.

name: Troubled Waters
description:
This small vignette is the first release a series of designs from Ink Circles called the Bad Neighborhoods. Each shows us what appears at first glance to be a nice place to take up residence. Upon closer inspection, we find that there is something amiss. Something that would make this a very bad neighborhood to live in after all.

What a lovely little town. Hanging baskets of flowers line the river. If it weren't for those dead fish floating along, nobody might have noticed that something sinister was draining from that pipe!  

There are 6 designs in this series. They will use a common color palette and will all be the same size, making it easy to combine them into a  larger design.

Cross stitch chart.  Each in the series are 71w x 81h. Stitched on Weeks Dye Works 30 count Beige linen using Gentle Arts Sampler and Shaker Threads.

name: What Lies Beneath
description:
This small vignette is the second release a series of designs from Ink Circles called the Bad Neighborhoods. Each shows us what appears at first glance to be a nice place to take up residence. Upon closer inspection, we find that there is something amiss. Something that would make this a very bad neighborhood to live in after all.

It looked like a perfect spot to build that charming adobe villa, but nobody knew about the ancient Indian burial ground.  Curses!  

There are 6 designs in this series. They will use a common color palette and will all be the same size, making it easy to combine them into a  larger design.

Cross stitch chart.  Each in the series are 71w x 81h. Stitched on Weeks Dye Works 30 count Angel Hair linen using Gentle Arts Sampler and Shaker Threads.

name: Tombstone Monkeys
description:
You've seen the three monkeys in the classic "See no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil" pose. These tombstone angels make the same gestures, with the epitaphs letting us know the tomb's occupant made a fatal mistake. If you're familiar with your patron saints, you might notice the gentle folks' names were not randomly selected.

Cross Stitch Chart.
Size 181w x 50h. Stitched on Vintage Lentil 40 count by Lakeside Linens with Gentle Arts Sampler and Shaker Threads.

name: Tomatoes
description:
an upside-down sampler.
Cross stitch chart only.

Size is 123w x 159h. Stitched with Weeks Dye Works floss on Weeks 30 count Beige linen.

name: Snow Spider
description:
Here's an idea for you this winter if you live in a snowy zone.  Turn your basic snowman into a snow spider by adding a few extra arms and a few extra eyes.  Even if you live in the tropics, you can can recreate this stitched version easily.

Cross Stitch Chart. Size 57w x 51h. Stitched on 32 count Stellar by Picture This Plus using Gentle Arts Sampler and Shaker Threads with just a touch of Kreinik Petite Braid #4 to give the eyes an iridescent touch.

name: Boo-ltimore
description:
A Halloween cross stitch Collaboration between Ink Circles and CherryWood Design Studios.

CherryWood is no longer in business, but they have graciously allowed me to continue selling the chart - both halves! When you order, you will receive two chart packs that together can be used to stitch the entire design.

Total dimensions and materials: 179 x 179 stitches. Stitched using Gentle Arts colors on 30 count Weeks Parchment linen. Colors: Gold Leaf (2), Barn Grey (3), Gingersnap (2), Chives, Carrot, Onyx (3).

name: Roll Your Own 2013
description: Stitch along with us on this kaleidoscopic mandala by Ink Circles. I'm providing 9 suggested DMC colorings (12 colors + black,) but I give very detailed info (and support) to select your own colorway using my special formulas. These patterns are exclusively online until May 2014. Chart is 115 stitches square and uses only whole stitches and any brand solid colored floss (like HDF :-). You will have access to the files and personalized support by way of a Yahoo Group. The group includes a discussion forum, photo albums, and info/previews about more alternate and customized colorways. Click here to join the Yahoo Group. There is no shipping cost for this item, as the product is delivered electronically. $15 gets you into the group and the first mandala chart. An additional $20 will get you the set of 6 MORE mandala charts as shown in the photos.

options.name: Whole Ball of Wax (includes group membership plus all six sequels)

name: Cirque des Coeurs
description:
If you've been waiting for the fourth in the Cirque series, your wait is over! Following Cercles, Triangles, and Carreaux: Cirque des Coeurs, which means Circus of the Hearts.

247 x 185 (same Cirque Size)

To be completed in your choice of colors; 17,981 little x'es (75 yards of 6-ply for 1 over 2 on 32 count fabric.

Shown in Carrie's Silk: Renegade on 32 count Bisque linen by Lakeside Linens.

name: Little Alien Schoolgirl
description:
So, you were perhaps wondering what a schoolgirl sampler would look like if it were made by a young girl on an alien planet at some time in the future?

A reproduction of Roswell time capsule artifact from a future colonial mission.

191 x 256 Stitches, done on 30 count Weeks Linen in Baby's Breath. Weeks Threads used: Galvanized (2), Tiger's Eye, Swiss Chocolate, Loden, Baked Apple (2), Red Pear, Blue Jeans (2), Cypress, Bullfrog, Terra Cotta, Cinnabar (2), Plum (2).

You are invited to read along in the blog where I discuss what some of these images might mean. (http://inkcircles.blogspot.com/) The chart includes our best guess as to the meaning of the motifs and text.

name: Holiday Magick
description:
An old alchemical treatise provided a squiggly glyph with the text instruction a person to embroider it in red silk on the garment worn closest to the heart to protect the wearer from evil spirits.

This little reindeer will charm away those evil spirits.

Stitched in 1 strand of red silk (Gloriana's Cranberry) on Picture This Plus Sand linen 40 count.

name: Dala Squid and Friends
description:
The Dala Horse has long been the unofficial mascot of Sweden; the cheery red folk carving is recognized around the globe as a Scandinavian icon. Here at Ink Circles, I wondered why horses should be having all of the fun. I created this series of similarly saddled critters to join in the celebrations. Stitch the sampler or use the individual animals for ornaments or other smalls.

107 by 80 Stitches, stitched in DMC on Weeks 30 ct Parchment linen. Uses DMC Memory Thread for the harnesses and reins. A graph is included that allows you to cross stitch the harnesses and reins in regular DMC if you prefer.

name: Masquerade
description:
Cross stitch chart

The quote I used is a favorite from an 1878 musical by Gilbert and Sullivan. Perfect for Halloween time, when things are truly sometimes not what they seem.

"Things are seldom what they seem, Skim milk masquerades as cream."

    William S. Gilbert
    H.M.S. Pinafore

Stitched with Gentle Art Sampler Threads on 40 count Vintage Tarnished Silver by Lakeside Linens.

105 x 187 stitch count.

Yes, the frame is available commercially. Get it custom made to your dimensions at pictureframes.com \.

name: The Smell of Sulfur
description:
Cross stitch chart

The raven watches from his perch in the cemetery tree. Crossed bones form a border of sorts. The symbol in the lower right corner is an alchemical shorthand for sulfur.

This design features five shades of Carrie's Thread in Silk and was worked on 40 count Vintage Tarnished Silver linen by Lakeside linen (1 over 2.)

73 x 73 stitch count.

name: Celtic Beasties: Halloween or Knot
description:
Cross stitch chart

The Wee Beasties are back at it. Several versions of each design allow you to stitch up these small designs for ornaments, needlecases, whatever you can imagine. Choose bright or antique color ways; Halloween versions or not-so-Halloweeny. Snakes and skulls, cats, bats, spiders and more.

43 or 44 x 53 stitch count.

Coded for Carrie’s Thread and shown on Sassy's handpainted 36 count linen.

name: Baroque
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

A monochromatic tribute to the ornate Baroque style. Nine central motifs can also be used for all sorts of smaller projects.

Stitchen on R&R's Creme Brulee Linen 35 count using Gloriana's Northern Lights.

251 x 251 stitch count.

Shown in Northern Lights by Gloriana on Creme Brulee Linen by R&R Reproductions 35 count, 1 strand over 2.

There are about 28,400 little x'es, which took about 24 yards of 12-ply silk at the given fabric count.

name: Love Letters - Fraktur
description:
The newest in this series of Love Letters charts. Each includes an alphabet and motif with a heart that are particular to a specific art style. In this case, it's Pennsylvania Dutch Fraktur Style.

I did this one in Gentle Arts Wool Threads, which seemed a perfect complement to the style. The fabric is Golden Harvest by Silkweavers. Stitch count is 96 x 88.

Look for more Love Letters - Art Nouveau and Celtic.

name: Rosetta
description:
Cross Stitch Chart.

This is your classic monochromatic, geometrical-based, no-punch-line Ink Circles design. It's shown in Gloriana silk in Cranberry on R&R Espresso Linen 40 count.  I'm certain we'll be seeing some great other fiber combinations from stitchers soon.

Size is 261 x 197. Number of stitches is 21,598.

name: Nut Jobs
description:
Cross Stitch Chart.

Believe me, I know that allergies are no joke, but I think we've gotten a little carried away with warning labels of all types. My inspiration for this sampler was seeing a tube of printing INK stating "gluten-free" in three languages! If you don't find that funny then I officially proclaim you as humorless or unable to help it due to some unfortunate circumstance such as employment as a product liability lawyer for some corporation.

Shown in Gloriana silk (Coffee Bean, Hazlenut, Olive Grove, Ollalieberry, Spanish Moss, and Dried Pink Roses) on 40ct Park City Blend R&R linen.

Stitch count is 165 x 218.

name: Metamorphosis
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This is the first in a series of charts where I’ve used Quaker motifs to illustrate a particular concept, in this case the transformation from one form into another. In seven steps the pot of flowers motif morphs into an octagonal design.  Seven shades of Gentle Art Sampler Threads also gently transition as the motifs change.

Stitch count is 359 x 47.

name: Mother Maya
description:
Cross stitch chart

Mother Maya is a sampling of motifs in the ancient Mexican
styles. Some are based on historic carvings, others were
chiseled from my imagination. I just love the dancing monkey Dude.

It's so hard to see just how beautiful the floss color is from this photo - Mojave fire is rust with hints of gold and olive. It takes 8 skeins

187 x225 stitch count. Individual motifs will make great ornaments or bookmarks.

name: Attractive Opposites
description:
Cross Stitch Charts.

Two designs that I've show both light on dark and dark on light. These were designed to line up perfectly on Weeks Dye Works gingham linen, but they look great on a solid linen too.  These were stitched with Dinky Dye's silks.

name: Four Seasonal Mandalas
description:
Cross stitch chart

If you're a steady subscriber to Just Cross Stitch magazine, you saw these four mandalas come through in various issues in 2010.

I'm making them all available in a single leaflet.

These four designs are cross stitched versions of the ink and watercolor mandala paintings that I make.

These are stitched in solid shades of Vikki Clayton's Hand Dyed Fibers, a very reasonably priced silk thread. They have exact conversion to DMC colors, and that list is provided.

They are stitched on Attic Lace linen, 32 count, by Lakeside Linens.

Each of the four designs is 101 x 101 stitches.

name: Woodland Vines
description:
Cross stitch chart

This piece was designed as a companion to Bramble and the Rose. (Bramble is on the light background in the photo of the pair.)

Stitch count is 231 x 231. It was stitched on Mystic 32 count linen by Picture This Plus using Marc's April Mai silk by Gloriana.

There were 17,850 stitches.

name: Bramble and the Rose
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

A monochromatic Celtic piece that will have your needle singing.

It's shown stitched in "Mostly-Deadly Nightshade," one of Carrie's creations. It took 12 skeins of floss (22,500 stitches) for 2 over 2 stitching. The fabric shown is Vintage Lentil 32 count by Lakeside Linens.

235 x235 stitch count. 

There is a companion piece available called Woodland Vines. In the picture of the pair of them, Woodland Vines is on the dark background.

name: Quaker Genetics
description:
Dedicated to all of those biologists out there, who've spent so many hours drawing up little tables and calculating what percentage of the peas should statistically be wrinkly.

This is in fact one of those tables, called a Punnet Square. Using two shapes of Quaker motifs and two colorings, it shows the outcome of dominant and recessive traits in the subsequent generations. 

Don't worry if that doesn't make too much sense; we're just trying to have a little fun. 

Fabric is 32 count Vintage Clay Pot by Lakeside Linens. 
Stitch count is 153 x 153.

Stitched in Gentle Arts Threads: 
2 Buttermilk 
4 Cherry Bark 
2 Espresso Bean 
1 Otter Creek

name: Til Karin - 4 Elements
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This sampler was designed and stitched by my Mum, Cindy Wasner. It will be coming out with "Norsk Needlework," her company name, on the chart but distribution will be available through Ink Circles.

You can read more about the inspiration for this sampler on her blog: norskneedlework.blogspot.com.

Stitch Count - 301 x 189.  Stitched on Legacy Picture This Plus Linen with Gentle Arts thread.

Errata - if you got one the charts from the first printing, there are two symbols that didn't convert properly on the key page.  Autumn leaves is an open circle; Toffee is a circle with a plus superimposed on it.  This has been fixed in later printings.

name: Love Letters - Art Nouveau
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Love Letters - Art Nouveau

This is the second chart in the Love Letters series. It was stitched on Mello 32 count linen by Picture This Plus using Gentle Arts Sampler Thread.  Stitch count is 89 x 86.

name: Instar - boxed set of 8 Notecards
description:
This unique combination of Celtic and entomological motifs drawn up in a striking black and white geometric pattern echoes the crazy, competing influences in my artistic life. The title of the piece is "Instar," which is the term entomologists (bug-studiers) use to describe the different developmental stages of insects. In the picture, you can see an adult beetle, her eggs, the larvae, and what's left of the leaf they munched on. I drew it using India ink.

Set of 8 notecards with white envelopes. These 5x7" cards are printed on heavy cardstock; blank on the inside. They are packed in a nice box with a clear plastic lid which keeps them safe and also makes a tidy looking gift.

If you are interested, prints of this drawing are also available. Check my other listings.

This image is copyrighted (c) 2011. The artist (that's me - Tracy Horner) retains all rights to the artwork. The watermark does not appear on the cards.

Cross stitch chart

Last summer I asked my friends and followers to tell me which brands of beers they liked. I had enthusiasts from around the globe tell me about their local breweries, spots they hit on vacation, and tastiest drinks. These range from familiar to obscure, but I steered away from the gas station case specials such as Coors and Bud, opting for more interested fare.

The chart will come with a "dance card" to allow you to check off beers either as you stitch them, spot them in a shop, or drink them - your choice.

I've had to take a few liberties to make the chart workable, but I think you'll find the individual character of each bottle stands out.

It goes without saying that the bottles and shelves can be rearranged to make different layouts and different sized pieces.

It's stitched in DMC, on 32 count (GET THIS!) "Ale" linen by Picture This Plus.  Stitch count 138 x 285.

ERRATA (so sorry!)

I've discovered that I did make a few oopses on the chart. They will be fixed in subsquent printings, but if you've gotten one of the first two batches please make note:

Missing symbols: three bottles have some white stitches blank. The Corona bottle (8A) is the only bottle that has unstitched squares inside the bottle.

    Kingfisher (3A)
    Victoria Bitter (3G)
    Tecate (4D)

Misplaced Bottles:

    Grolsch is really 4E
    Apricot Hefe - 5E
    Singha is in 8B
    Mackeson XXX- 9J

I do appreciate hearing about and having a chance to fix my mistakes.

name: Earbuds
description:
This is the culmination of all those tiny 10 x 10 album covers you might have seen on my FaceBook page.  Each of the little albums is mounted on a tiny neodymium magnet and a steel plate is behind the stitching. You can move the albums around to show "what's playing" on your MP3 player.  We are currently listening to some Rolling Stones.  The instructions on assembling Earbuds as an interactive piece are included with the chart.

This was based on an ink drawing I made where the headphone cords made some decidedly more artistic knots than the knots they usually make in real life.

You can (of course) stitch the album covers directly on the background fabric and frame or finish as a normal piece.  You can also stitch the mp3 player and cords in a custom color combo to match your own player.

This was stitched with DMC on Picture This Plus "Stellar" linen.

name: Quiddity
description:
Cross stitch chart

Quiddity means the very essence of a thing, and this small design captures a lot of the essence of an Ink Circles design.

This inkling calls for two shades of thread. I've chosen a variegated silk by Thread Gatherer and a deep purple from Gloriana.

It's stitched on 36 count linen from Stitches and Spice (1 over 2.)

The box was made by Olde Colonial Designs

55 x 55 stitch count.

name: Norsk Fairytale
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

A new one from my Mum, who brought you the Fjord Ponies.

This one has a few Hardanger-style specialty stitches, but don't fret. Clear large diagrams of everything are included.

Stitched on 36 Count Relic by Picture This Plus using Gentle Arts Sampler Threads.

298 x 186 stitch count.

Designed and stitched by Cynthia Wasner.

name: Willow Berries
description:
Cross Stitch Chart.

Stitched up in four shades of Dinky-Dyes silk on Mello 32 count Belfast linen from Picture This Plus. Count is 129x129.

name: Alto Gether Now
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling for that musical person in your life.

58 x 62 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Vintage Homespun linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. with Crescent Colours. A DMC conversion is supplied.

Also check out the companion treble clef (Here Comes Treble) and the bass clef (First Bass.)

name: First Bass
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling for that musical person in your life.

60 x 59 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Vintage Homespun linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. with Crescent Colours. A DMC conversion is supplied.

Also check out the companion treble clef (Here Comes Treble) and the alto clef (Alto Gether Now.)

name: Here Comes Treble
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling for that musical person in your life.

60 x 61 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Vintage Homespun linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. with Crescent Colours. A DMC conversion is supplied.

Also check out the companion bass clef (First Bass) and alto clef (Alto Gether Now.)

name: Love Letters - Celtic
description:
Cross stitch chart

This is the first in a series of small samplers that feature a heart motif and an alphabet in a particular art style.

The letters are an uncial hand, which dates back centuries in old Celtic texts.

A heart entwined with a trinity knot completes the design.

It is stitched on Vintage Lentil linen by Lakeside Linens and Design. The threads are by Gentle Art Sampler Threads. Stitch count is 89 x 81.

name: Shy Violet
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling to stitch up. Don't be shy.

47 x 47 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Vintage River Willow linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. with three shades of Gentle Arts Sampler Thread. A DMC conversion is supplied.

name: Just Rosy
description:
Cross stitch chart

This special design is a cross stitched version of the ink and watercolor mandala paintings that I make. Now you can stitch your own mandala masterpiece with 13 vibrant shades of DMC.

123 x123 stitch count.

name: Bite Me - Fins Version
description:
Cross stitch chart

While not strictly Celtic, this is one of three designs that bring you a collection of playful, imaginative beasties engaged in mid-chomp.

Choose the version with finny, furry or feathered creatures.

Each is stitched with Dinky-Dyes silk on Picture This Plus linen.

91 x 91 stitch count.

name: Bite Me - Feathers Version
description:
Cross stitch chart

While not strictly Celtic, this is one of three designs that bring you a collection of playful, imaginative beasties engaged in mid-chomp.

Choose the version with finny, furry or feathered creatures.

Each is stitched with Dinky-Dyes silk on Picture This Plus linen.

91 x 91 stitch count.

name: Bite Me - Fur Version
description:
Cross stitch chart

While not strictly Celtic, this is one of three designs that bring you a collection of playful, imaginative beasties engaged in mid-chomp.

Choose the version with finny, furry or feathered creatures.

Each is stitched with Dinky-Dyes silk on Picture This Plus linen.

91 x 91 stitch count.

name: Oatmeal Quaker
description:
Cross stitch chart

Some folks associate hot cereal with the term Quaker. So to give our oatmeal loving, sampler loving friends a tribute to both I created the Oatmeal Quaker.

It features the Oat plant in the center, steaming bowls and a pair of spoons. The motifs are all Quaker style and represent the different toppings for your cereal. There are grapes for raisins, bees for honey, an apple tree, strawberries, maple leaves for syrup, and a pitcher of fresh cream. There are also a pair of heads of wheat if you prefer a nice triticale or farina. Dig in.

Stitched with Briar Patch silk (Belle Soie by Crescent Colours)on 32 count Pearled Barly linen by Lakeside Linens. It will take 2 skeins of silk.

131 x 131 stitch count.

name: Fjord Ponies
description:
Cross stitch chart

This sampler started out life as a sweater!

My Mum, Cindy Wasner, designs Scandanavian styled knitted sweaters and accessories under the company name Norsk Needlework. Her Wild Blue Horses sweater featured Norwegian Fjord Ponies and Tree of Life motifs on a background of snowflakes and angels. As these fine-gauge motifs work so well for embroidery, she chose to rework things in that medium. Her Fjord Ponies sampler is the result.

You can find and purchase her sweater and accessories pattern at her site: Norsk Needlework.

Since her sampler pattern will find itself at home better amongst other cross stitch charts, she's permitting me to handle the marketing and distribution.

Stitched with seven shades of Vikki Clayton's Hand-dyed Silks on Vintage Sugar Maple 36 count by Lakeside Linens.

296 x 296 stitch count.

Designed and stitched by Cynthia Wasner.

name: Red Square
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little arabesque executed in red silk.

Stitched with four shades of Carrie's Silks on Vintage Lentil 36 count by Lakeside Linens.

119 x 119 stitch count.

name: Piccalilli
description:
Cross stitch chart

A lacy little square that is perfect for featuring an overdyed thread. I've made mine into a cover for a pad of Post-it (r) notes. See how by visiting my Tutorials page. Instructions are posted here. It would also make a fine needlebook, ornament or box top.

Stitched with Lilly Pilly Dinky-Dyes silk floss on 40 count Green Slate linen by Lakeside Linens. (1 over 2)

53 x 53 stitch count.

name: Florin and Guilder
description:
Cross Stitch Charts (sold separately)

Florin and Guilder are names for the coins used in the Netherlands before the Euro was introduced. They date back to ancient times when the tulip was the real currency of that land.  These two tulip-inspired squares are stitched with Carrie's Silks on 32 count Lakeside Linens.  Florin (left) is the August "Stitch Your Heart Out" chart and support the Carol for Heart charity. Guilder (right) was conceived to make good use of the leftover threads, saving you some coins.

49 x 49 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Porcelain linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using six colors of silk by Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads. One silk pack is plenty to stitch both designs.

A DMC conversion is supplied.

name: Growth Rings
description:
Cross stitch chart

This chart was originally published in the March/April 2009 issue of Just Cross Stitch. It is now being offered in this stand-alone format.

Stitch count is 229w x 229h.

The model was stitched on 32 count Bisque linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. The silks used were premium weight Yawning Mountain and Exemplar Flannel from Vikki Clayton's Hand-Dyed Fibers line.

Stitch count is 13609 dark and 3818 stitches of the lighter color.

name: Turkish Delight
description:
Cross stitch chart

These motifs were inspired by the beautiful blue and white tiles that have decorated Turkish buildings for centuries. Its theme song? - Blue Rondo a la Turk.

Stitch count is 195w x 139h.

The model was stitched on 32 count Bisque linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. The silks used were Purple Paradise and Blue Heaven by Belle Soie. (Stitch count is 6824 dark, 4412 light.)

This piece also works well hung in a vertical orientation (rotated 90 degrees clockwise.)

name: Aventail
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling to stitch up.

57 x 57 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 40 count Vintage Navy Bean linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using "Freo" hand-dyed silk thread by Dinky Dyes.

name: Petits Fours
description:
Cross stitch chart

Petits Fours are those wonderful little gourmet caked, layered with yummy fillings, iced with colorful decorative frosting.

This started out with four small corner motifs, but grew to be a very versatile collection of treats.

Main design is 93 x 93 stitch count.

Included are four narrow borders that fit (interchangeably) the four corner motifs - see the biscornu. Biscornu instructions are also included. These framed corners can also be used for ornaments and other smalls, as can be the central diamond motif.

A full, fancy alphabet is included that can be used with the frames. I've used it on the needlebook.

The models were stitched on various 32 count linens by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. (Vintage Exemplar, Bisque, and Tundra) using Vikki Clayton's Hand-dyed silks.

name: Pretty Little Dust Collector
description:
Cross stitch chart

A little inkling by the youngest member of the Ink Circles design team...

This biscornu was designed and stitched by my daughter, Hannah, as a community service project and an opportunity to try her hand at creating an original design. A portion of the profits is being donated to our local Pet Over Populated Prevention organization.

Each side is 49 stitches square. Instructions for sewing the biscornu are included.

The model was stitched on 32 count Belfast linen in Carnation Pink and Ice Blue using DMC cotton threads.

name: Quaker Quilts: Monkey Wrench
description:
Cross stitch chart

Traditionally styled Quaker motifs are laid out in the framework of a classic patchwork quilt block called the Monkey Wrench. Some quilters may also know this block as the Churn Dash, but I've always thought Monkey Wrench to be the cooler name.

It's stitched in 4 shades of Carrie's thread and would be adaptable to a variety of palettes. A DMC conversion is provided. The beautiful pale green linen shown is 32 count Tundra by Lakeside Linens

193 x193 stitch count.

name: Fleur d'Orleans
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This is the first chart in a new category of Ink Circles charts. It's not a series, per se, but more of a format of little ideas - "Inklings."

From my convoluted little mind, a fun little project for your rotation. Fleur d'Orleans makes a great beginner project or a quick fix between your larger Ink Circles endeavors.

53 x 71 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Bisque linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using four colors of silk by Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

A DMC conversion is supplied.

name: The Huddle: Ornament Chart/Silks
description:
Cross stitch kit including chart, floss, fabric, and beads.

New options! You may order just the chart, or the chart plus the silks and noses. Look under the options tab.

The 2009 Christmas Ornament kit is still available. It is stitched up with 8 shades of brown silk by Carrie's Threads. The one yard of each included is enough to stitch it three times over on 28 or 32 count (using 2 strands) or six times on 40 count. 

You might need to look twice and reread the title to see the reindeer. That's a whole lot of antlers!

name: Quaker Geometric Puzzle
description:
Cross stitch chart

Quaker samplers typically have some arrangement of motifs that provide a pleasing layout. This chart uses bits and pieces of Quaker motifs in a symmetrical arrangement called a mandala. I call it a Quaker puzzle, as the motifs interlock like a jigsaw.

It's charted for DMC, and shown stitched in a very autumnal palette on Attic Lace 32 count linen by Lakeside Linens. It would look very nice converted to silks or done in an alternate selection of colors.

235 x235 stitch count.

If you got one of the copies from the first print run the stitch count on the back was incorrect. ~so sorry!~

name: Quaker Floral Puzzle
description:
Cross stitch chart

Quaker samplers typically have some arrangement of motifs that provide a pleasing layout. This chart uses bits and pieces of floral Quaker motifs in a symmetrical arrangement called a mandala. I call it a Quaker puzzle, as the motifs interlock like a jigsaw.

It's charted for DMC, and shown stitched in a pastel palette on Charcoal 40 count linen by Lakeside Linens. It would look very nice converted to silks or done in an alternate selection of colors. I've provided the DMC numbers for the alternate way shown.

225 x225 stitch count.

name: Namaste
description:
Cross stitch chart

The word Namaste is a greeting that means, “I bow to you” or “The light
within me honors the light within you.” The greeting may be used with religious context (Buddhist, Hindus, and others) or without, such as a respectful salutation at a yoga practice.

Chakras are energy centers located within the body, aligned in the
sequence shown in this banner. They are attributed with governing the various properties of the body—both physical and mental. Your wellbeing
is dependant on your seven chakras working in balance. Yoga is one method of attaining and keeping this balance.

Traditionally, each chakra is characterized by a particular color, shape, and number of petals. My chakra mandalas reflect those graphic origins. Of course, it is your choice to believe or dismiss
the symbolic meaning of these seven small
mandalas offered in this chart. The appeal of the
colors and symmetry may be enough to interest you. Enjoy.

Charted for DMC, because you would hate me if you had to buy 22 specialty threads for such a small project (but this might be a great stash project: 3 shades each of the 7 colors + black.)

The largest motif is 41 x 41 stitches. If stitched together as a banner, it is 41 x 315.

name: Bright Idea
description:
Cross stitch chart

For an instant “A-Ha! Moment” stitch this piece and hang it behind your thinking chair or anywhere you need or find a little inspiration. This also makes the perfect stitched gift for the electrical engineer, power plant operator, or door-to-door light bulb salesman on your gift list.

This design uses four shades of Carrie's Thread, and was stitched on 32 count Ray of Light Belfast linen.

129 x146 stitch count.

name: Celtic Quilts: Kentucky Chain
description:
Cross stitch chart

This is the fourth design in the Celtic Quilts series. A traditional patchwork quilt design provides the starting point. Overdyed threads bring the woven pathways to life.

93 x 93 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Vintage Lentil linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using Carri'es Threads hand-dyed threads in cotton. A DMC conversion is provided, but Thanksgiving, used for the main diamond pathway, is multicolored and doesn't have a DMC counterpart.

A thread pack for this chart is sold separately.

name: Tanglewood
description:
Cross stitch chart

Stitch count is 198 x 262.

The Tanglewood Celtic pattern was originally published in the September/October 2007 issue of Just CrossStitch Magazine, which is available through the company website as a back-issue. If you're stitching from the magazine, please visit my Oopses and Extras page to download a correction page. Stitcher's have helped locate a few spots on the chart where the magazine was off.

The good news for those who can't get the magazine: the chart is now available here as a stand-alone leaflet.

name: Nine Lives
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Chinese calligraphy is so beautiful and elegant. This piece was inspired by a book in which I saw the Shou character for "long life" written dozens of different ways.

Each of the red centers in the lattice squares is a different way. Think of each as a mini stitched blessing for a long life. (You'll need it if you have as much stash as I do.)

This design uses five shades of Carrie's Thread, with a DMC conversion included. In the thread packs, I'm including 2 skeins each of the red and darkest gray as some stitchers might need them depending on the fabric count and stitching methods.

121 x121 stitch count. Individual squares and smaller grouping of squares offer additional possibilities.

A thread pack for this chart is sold separately.

name: Celtic Quilts: Friendship Star
description:
Cross stitch chart

This is the third in a series of patterns that got their inspiration from traditional patchwork quilt squares. If you look closely, you might be able to recognize the quilt pattern peeking out through this Celtic lattice. The quilt block's title Frienship Star seemed to work well with the hearts and tulips that make up my patches and these bright spring colors.

93 x 93 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Bisque linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

A DMC conversion is provided, but you will have a difficult time finding an equal of the "Spring Delight" that wanders around the block and through many color families.

name: Twisted Heart
description:
Cross stitch chart

From my twisted mind, a fun little project for your rotation. Twisted Heart makes a great beginner project or a quick fix between your larger Ink Circles endeavors.

59 x 59 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count vintage Exemplar linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using four colors of Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

name: Cirque des Carreaux
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Diamond-shaped tiles overlap and fill the spaces. A happy companion to Cercles and Triangles. You'll find that many of these motifs work out to make perfect charts for ornaments and smaller repeats

247 x 185 stitch count.

Shown in Carrie's Thread "Epiphany" on Lakeside Linen's Vintage Tarnished Silver 32 count.

Just a few stitches shy of the 17,000 stitch mark in a single floss color of your choice (although experienced needleworkers are invited to incorporate multiple colors to customize the design.) You have to pick your own favorite colors.

Requires 9 skeins of DMC for 2 stranded stitching.

name: Pot Luck
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Here is a simple but elegant little potted plant. Will it bring you luck? Adapt this to any color palette or linen count.

77 x 105 stitch count.

Shown stitched on Mustard colored Lugana with Coffee silk floss by Carrie's Threads.

Requires 10 yards of 6 ply floss on 28 count fabric.

name: Croakworth
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

n 2007, Ink Circles brought you a Quacker-style sampler in the antique tradition of the Quackworth School. It has come to surface that the local amphibians attending the Croakworth School have had a long-standing tradition of their own...

62 x 192 stitch count.

Stitched in Valdani threads on Pear (right) and Luna (left) linens by Lakeside Linens.

ERRATA: Be it senility, dsylexia, or a DMC color card from the Twilight Zone, somehow the printed charts have a few non-existent DMC numbers cited as references to the Valdani Colors used.

Please note, the Antique Violet color is nearest 3041 and Chimney Dust is nearest 3781. My apologies. - T

name: Bloomers
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This subtle floral mandala shows off a variety of blossoms in a pleasing symmetrical arrangement.

Coded for 7 shades of DMC, but easily changed to match the bouquet in your dreams. Stitched on Palomino linen by Lakeside Linens.

143 x 143 stitch count.

I've added a photo of the same design stitched in jungle bright colors.  Amazing how different it can look!

name: Pizzazz
description:
Cross stitch chart

Because you needed another excuse to go buy some more fancy floss.

Named after the Carrie's Thread color in which it was stitched. You'll need 3 eight yard skeins.

103 x 103 stitch count.

name: Much Heralded Sampler
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

What started out as a good way to tell the well-armored knights apart on the battlefield has since evolved into a very ornate, very complicate graphic system. 

Bits and pieces of various heraldic devices are combined with a row of castle silhouettes.

293 x 207 stitch count.

Coded for Carrie’s Thread. Stitched on Basketweave Linen by Lakeside Linens.

name: Celtic Quilts: Crown of Squares
description:
Cross stitch chart

This is the second design in the Celtic Quilts series. A traditional patchwork quilt design provides the starting point. Overdyed threads bring the woven pathways to life.

93 x 93 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Chantilly Creme linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using Gentle Art Sampler Thread hand-dyed threads.

name: Dutch Beast
description:
Cross stitch chart

I’m not sure how I can describe this sampler in just a few sentences, partly because it is more than a typical sampler. Collectors and avid stitchers can point to dozens and dozens of traditional Dutch Samplers, both antiques reproductions and “modern” antiques. On those, we find traditional motifs in many varied versions.  Each of these motifs has a story or is a symbol of something - Adam and Eve, the Ten Virgins, Windmills, and Double-Headed Eagles.

On the Dutch Beast, each of the motifs has a story too. The Dutch Beast stories begin with the traditional stories, but end up in a very different place.

The chart pack includes a lengthy supplement with pictures and text providing the historical significance of each motif and explaining the spoofs.

It’s sure to keep you in stitches while it keeps you in stitches.

The sampler was done using Vikki Clayton’s Hand-Dyed Fibers on 40 count Vintage Navy Bean Lakeside Linen.

Design size is 248 x 308.

name: Celtic Beasties: Christmas or Knot
description:
Cross stitch chart

These Celtic creatures are pulling double duty to bring year-round smiles. What started out as a series of Christmas ornaments inspired by the tangled beasts found in old Celtic manuscripts, soon grew to a set of projects sure to please all.  In addition to the holiday setting, the Dog, the Griffin, the Stag, and a Pair of Peacocks are each presented in a non-seasonal design.

To further double the fun, each was fully charted for two separate colorways. You can see examples of the muted antique-y colors and the non-seasonal motifs as well as the Christmas versions  in the bright colorways in the photos.

45 x 49 stitch count each. These are the perfect size for ornaments, needlecases, pinkeeps, and more.

The model were stitched on a rainbow of hand-painted linens from Sassy’s Fabbys in 32 and 36 counts using Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

name: Peregrination
description:
Cross stitch chart

That’s just a fancy way of saying wandering travels, and the Celtic pathways on this chart do certainly peregrinate.   Designs like this are a great way to show off a hand-dyed thread that varies from color to color.  Let your imagination roam as your fingers stitch up these intertwining ribbons and the colors unfold.

153 x 153 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Lavender Bliss Belfast linen using Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.  

A thread pack is sold separately.

name: Celtic Quilts: Corn & Beans
description:
Cross Stitch chart

If you look closely, you might be able to recognize the traditional quilt pattern peeking out through this Celtic lattice. I can’t begin to guess why the quilt block was called Corn and Beans, but as I worked the palette of greens on the yummy yellow fabric, the name stuck.  Was I still hungry when I added Carrie’s Peach and Blueberry threads? Remember, it’s important to get plenty of fruits and vegetables!

93 x 93 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Celtic Gold linen by Lakeside Linens & Designs, Inc. using Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

The thread pack is available separately.

See all four designs in this series.

name: Gina Queen of the Seas
description:
Cross stitch chart

This mermaid design was inspired by the Maid of Meigle, a 1000 year old (or more!) Pictish rock carving found near Perthshire, Scotland.  The stone is now housed in the Meigle Sculptured Stone Museum in Dundee.  My mermaid was named in honor of my friend and model stitcher who had faith in Ink Circles from the first day.

163 x 163 stitch count.

The design is mainly cross stitch, with some backstitch/blackwork areas. The model was stitched on 32 count Ice Blue Belfast linen using Carrie’s hand-dyed Threads.

The Carries Thread thread pack is available separately.

name: Cirque des Triangles
description:
Cross stitch chart

(Circus of the Triangles)

This is a companion piece to Cirque des Cercles featuring (somehow, you’ve probably already guessed this) interlocking triangles in a pleasing geometric layout. Stitch it to match or come up with an entirely new color scheme.  Use motifs individually - the possibilities are endless.

247 x 185 stitch count.

Just a few stitches shy of the 20,000 stitch mark in a single floss color of your choice.

I've updated the chart to have a different cover model - a lovely red on a light brown background.  If for some reason you really want the older blue version just say so in the comment field.

name: Cirque des Cercles
description:
Cross stitch chart

Interlocking circles provide a pleasing geometric layout for these stylized floral mandalas.  Nature abhors a vacuum, and so do I (I abhorred my Eureka, and am only barely able to tolerate our Hoover Wind-tunnel.) Thus, to avoid big empty spaces, the interstices between circles are filled with smaller circles and so on, and so on, resulting in quite a circus of circles  (which just happens to sound cooler in French.)

247 x 185 stitch count.

Just a few stitches shy of the 20,000 stitch mark in a single floss color of your choice (although experienced needleworkers are invited to incorporate multiple colors to customize the design.) You have to pick your own favorite colors.

name: Hanky Pysanky
description:
Cross stitch chart

This sampler was inspired by the Ukrainian art of pysanky, where beeswax is applied with a fine stylus and multiple layers of dyeing transform a simple egg into a work of art.

224 x 160 stitch count.

The model was stitched on 32 count Black Belfast linen using Carrie’s Threads.  Two separate colorways are suggested: the pinks as shown in the sampler version as well as a rainbow palette shown on the smalls.

Thread packs are available in both colorways.

Pattern includes finishing instructions for this Biscornu and Scissor Keeper.

name: Hawaiian Mandala Sampler
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Whether you’re saying “When you dance, leave your bashfulness at home” (which is A'a i ka hula, waiho ka hilahila i ka hale) or Merry Christmas (the familiar: Mele Kalikimaka) the Hawaiians need only 12 letters to do it. That’s a whole lot of hula packed into 54% less alphabet than the rest of us need.

These tropical colors spill out into floral mandalas that are reminiscent of the traditional Hawaiian quilts.

127 x 201 stitch count.

name: Blackstone Fantasy Garden
description:
Cross stitch chart

This Celtic design uses hand-dyed multicolor floss to create the woven pathways.  Each of the spaces between the paths is in full bloom with blackwork flowers.

225 x 225 stitch count.

Coded for Carrie’s Thread with a DMC conversion included.

name: Quackworth
description:
Cross stitch chart

With a wink towards the historical Ackworth School in West Yorkshire, England, this sampler is a painstaking rendition of an antique sampler completed at the Quackworth School, an independent boarding  school in the Columbia Basin for prestigious waterfowl (the Quackers).

62 x 192 stitch count.

These models were stitched on 40 count Lakeside Linens over 2 using 1 strand of floss. The monochromatic version uses Carrie’s Thread in Rusty Nail on Bisque fabric. Olde Willow Stitchery Hand-dyed threads were used on Green Slate fabric for the version on the right.

name: Anatolia
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

The pattern bands on this sampler were inspired by the many antique carpets found in centuries-old mosques in Anatolia, the Asian portion of modern day Turkey.  Some carpets dating back to the 13th and 14th centuries have been remarkably well preserved because of the practice of layering newly donated carpets atop them on the mosque floors. Many of these carpets have found their way into museums where they can be enjoyed by admirers. This sampler is true to the original carpet patterns in that motif colors and shape sometimes change subtly as they are repeated. The use of overdyed threads in this sampler also mimics the color changes that are seen in the original carpets.

225 x 300 stitch count.

Coded for Carrie’s Thread, but a DMC conversion can be found on my Oopses and Extras page.

name: I Still Do and Second Chances
description:
Cross stitch charts - includes both designs

What better way to commemorate a milestone anniversary than with a lovely personalized sampler. Twenty years ago I said, “I Do.”  In 2007, I was happy and lucky enough to be saying that I still did. A full alphabet and numeral set is included to help you customize this for your special tribute.

But because not everyone needs or wants a large anniversary sampler, I’ve reworked many of the motifs into a smaller all-occasion sampler.  These motifs were given a “second chance” outside of their initial romantic setting. This sampler went through many naming iterations and was known for a long time just as that purple sampler. Because of its resemblance to oriental tiles, it flirted briefly with the French title: “Les Carrelages de l’Orient.” What ever you wish to call it, it looks fabulous done up in Carrie’s hand-dyed floss.

Stitch count for I Still Do is 300w x 380 h. It was worked in a collection of overdyed reds on 32 count Antique Ivory Belfast linen, two over two. 

Stitch count for Second Chances is a more modest 250w x 196h. This one showcases 11 of Carrie’s purple hand-dyed threads on 32 count Light Mocha Belfast linen, two over two.

name: This Heart of Mine
description:
Cross stitch chart

This spring-inspired monochromatic Quaker style design is a perfect break from those BIG Ink Circles charts you have been stitching.

Stitch count is 95 w by 102 h with 4163 little x’es.  For 28 count fabric, stitching 2 strands over 2 threads, you will need 16 yards of 6-ply floss.

Note: Some stitcher’s may need 3 skeins when using Carrie’s Threads on 28 ct.

The model shown was worked 2 over 2 in Carrie’s Creation “Green” on 30 count Legacy Linen “Parchment”.

name: Garden Stars
description:
Cross stitch chart

Leaves and flowers; birds and bees. Springtime gardens are growing and blooming.  Get out every color of green in you stash...then use this design as your excuse to find more wonderful colors. Dozens of decorative motifs based on mandala designs can be used individually or combined as shown to create a spectacular sampler.

364 x 280 stitch count.

Coded for DMC, but easily adapts to your favorite overdyed sampler threads.

name: Sea Stars
description:
Cross stitch chart

Dozens of decorative motifs based on mandala designs swim amongst my favorite items from the sea.  Use motifs individually or combine them as shown to create a spectacular sampler.

241x241 stitch count.

Coded for DMC, but easily adapts to your favorite overdyed sampler threads.

name: Kaleidoscope
description:
Cross stitch chart.

This special design is a cross stitched version of the ink and watercolor mandala paintings that I make. Now you can stitch your own mandala masterpiece with 34 vibrant shades of DMC.

145 x145 stitch count.

Note: Stitchers may require a fourth skein of DMC black (310) if stitching on 28 ct.

name: Dogwood Square
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This celtic design was named for the colors and shapes of the four-petalled dogwood flowers that grow in our area.

121 x121 stitch count.

Coded for DMC, only because this design predates my discovery of the wonderful Carries Threads. I have pulled together a conversion for anyone wanting to stitch this in her vibrant jewel-toned hand-dyed floss.

name: Octopus's Garden
description:
Cross stitch chart

Two octopi play in the kelp bed.

99 x 68 stitch count; Coded for DMC.

Model stitched on Belfast Linen 32 ct - mint green.

name: My Other Garden
description:
Cross stitch chart

A short verse and some rather unique flowers encourage you to spend some time inside your head being creative.

119 x 151 stitch count.

The Model was stitched using thread by The Dye is Cast, which is sadly no longer being made. A conversion is being offered to complete this design in Carrie’s Thread, as well as provide a DMC reference.

name: Telemark Rose
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This floral design was inspired by the traditional Norwegian painting stye called Rosemaling.

81 x 69 stitch count.

Coded for DMC.

name: Cross for Anne
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This celtic cross was designed for my friend Anne.

93 x131 stitch count.

Coded for DMC

name: Beau Leggy in the Desert
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

This bandy young cowpoke and his animal friends are so excited that a pretty young cowgirl just rode into town.

70 x 106 stitch count.

Coded for DMC.

name: Calamity Pippi and the Horse She Rode In On
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Pippi’s new to these parts. Her long little doggie goes everywhere with her. She’s heard about that cute cowpoke Beau and can’t wait to meet him.

70 x 106 stitch count.

Coded for DMC.

name: Alchemical Romance
description:
Cross Stitch Chart

Scientists in medieval times used these beautiful and enigmatic symbols in their manuscripts as a shorthand for various chemicals and processes. Although none of their works led to the discovery of the Philosopher’s Stone or the ability to create gold from a base metal, many wonderful scientific advances were made, opening the field for modern chemists. The chartpack includes a key to the symbolic meanings, from the earth, air, fire, and water triangles in the corners to the nine golden symbols for gold in the center.

245 x 197 stitch count.

Coded only as “gold” and “not gold”, this sampler can be worked in thread colors of your choice.
